fixes.name: Date MSG
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR useCustom = SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As])
VAR paramEnd = SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As])
VAR paramStart = SELECTEDVALUE('Start Date'[Display As])
VAR maxDate = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Max Date]
VAR minDate = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Min Date]
RETURN
IF(
    useCustom,
    "",
    IF(
        (maxDate < paramEnd) || (minDate > paramEnd),
        "End Date is out of range. Select a date within the Min & Max Date",
        IF(
            (minDate > paramStart) || (maxDate < paramStart),
            "Start Date is out of range. Select a date within the Min & Max Date",
            IF(
                ((maxDate < paramEnd) || (minDate > paramEnd)) && ((minDate > paramStart) || (maxDate < paramStart)),
                "Dates are out of range. Select dates within the Min & Max Date",
                ""
            )
        )
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF/ELSE logic to nested DAX IF statements. Parameter references were mapped to SELECTEDVALUE('ParameterName'[Display As]) and assigned to variables. Calculated fields Max Date and Min Date were referenced using the table-qualified names. Kept the original string messages unchanged.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation references parameters, and all parameter-based calculations must be measures.
